reviews.review_msg: This person changed my life, though I didn't know it at the time. He opened the insight into literature that I'd been stubbornly and youthfully denying myself. I became a successful writer and journal editor, albeit in science.  I'm honored to have the chance to write him this brief encomium.
No Comments
very funny prof
Promoted discussion in lecture and brought up/clarified points made by students. Very helpful, a little dry. Overall a good professor!

Peter is a great prof! He made class engaging and fun (even on a monday morning). He pushes you to be a better writer and actually made me enjoy English class for once. He also has great taste in reading material!

Kept class entertaining! Definately not like other professors, he can somewhat relate to us. However, he has really high expectations. Very analytic, so the essay topics were not so easy! Ended up with a B.
He tries very hard to keep the class' attention. Know the books, and its 'analyzed meaning of it'.
I loved Peter's lectures! always amusing, and the assignments and exams were clear and fair.
Best english class ever. Very enthusiastic teacher and if you pay attention in lectures, the class is a breeze
very strict marking scheme.

The course wasn't as interesting as I thought it to be but the guy really loves what he is teaching. One BAD thing about this course is there is way too much work for a 100 level intro english course. It was kinda rough having him as a tutorial leader.
Lectures are dynamic and interesting. Course materials are not overly difficult. This is probably the best course to get an ENGL credit. He is one of the best professors in SFU.
Really nice guy...seemed very passionate about literary drama. His dynamic teaching style and outgoing personality make the course substance way more interesting.
He is one of the best profs I've ever had - dynamic, funny and very intelligent.  Awesome lecturer!

It's so great to have a prof who just oozes creativity. He is the best person to have a 9:30 class with 'cause it puts you in a good mood all day long. I'm always tempted to declare my undying love for him!

Higgins is one of the worst professors I've had. Her lectures are prepared speeches on the weeks topic, and not very good ones at that. She is hard to follow and incredibly dull. She reminds me of a really bad high school english teacher.

Nadine assigns two different papers with vague instructions for you to interpret on your own but has her own expectations that are difficult to meet. Lectures are not important as she talks a lot about the author and not really anything about the text and how to interpret it.
Pretty chill, reasonable prof, I'd take another course with her. Fair marking, not an easy A though.

Awesome prof! lecture are truly engaging, and material is just astounding, this class changed how I view English, and prior to this class I never liked English (first English class in university) recommend her.. and pay attention in lecture she summarizes all the readings so take notes and read prior to the class, TA's also dictate marks,prof helps
She is a solid professor. She is a clear speaker, and interesting to listen to. I had a T.A. mark me, so I can't fairly comment on her marking difficulty.

You must attend lectures if you want to understand his take on all the texts...you can't rely on someone's notes for this.  He goes on some tangents, but they're usually interesting ones.  His essay questions and test questions are a little difficult, but if you study hard, you'll do well.  Make sure to attend tutorials, attendance is taken.

Burnham is your not your typical university professor. His use of social media helps students with course access. It was my mistake to take readings for granted; now I'm paying for it (literally). Lacanian terms WILL be the emphasis for all his readings so be sure to get your head around those concepts! But he's an amiable character without a doubt

He's hilarious. He's so aloof during his lectures, very down to earth guy. He prepares you very well for papers and tests. You can tell he is a laid back guy, he tried to allow us to have no final exam but the english dept said no. He's amazing as a TA.
At first I found this class very boring (and I still do somewhat) but he's so funny that I'm able to forgive him.
I think he's hilarious.  Really, he's the highlight of my Tuesdays and Thursdays.  Sure, his expectations are sometimes a little unclear, but he makes up for that in his digressing during lectures.
Generally good

Nicky is a great professor, she's very personable and she's the only teacher that I've felt extremely comfortable approaching and asking for help. That being said her lectures can be long if you're not interested in the material and they can get a little off topic with constant participation from students mandatory.

In the course outline, take "Gender Role" as "Women's Studies". Turned a class that is supposed to be about drama into a class about feminism. Some plays analysed are interesting, yet the class seems to focus on the feminist point of view far too much, ignoring other important elements. Change title of course to "Women's Studies" please.

Possibly the worst professor I  have ever had. One lecture we edited a wikipedia article regarding the play. Not only are the in-lecture activities tedious and dragged out, she constantly refers to plays that aren't part of the course materials.

Easy course, very few assignments. Lectures are useful some of the time. She has too much class discussion which is a waste of time unless you like hearing the opinions of a bunch of 1st years.  But if you go to the class and read the plays, the exam is very easy.

Most uninformative lectures I've ever attended. The only reason I actually did attend them was to get participation marks.
 
 she's the type of prof u either love or hate.
 
 I highly suggest another course, unless you are really into drama

I took this class because I was interested in the subject. I thought I was taking a class about drama. It turns out I was just taking a class about feminism with a completely self-absorbed professor. No one knows how to ruin a course like Didicher. I'm going to make sure I never take another one of her courses.
She's too much into WebCT and lectures are boring filled with discussions, you don't really learn anything from them. Just read the plays and you'll be fine.
She is alright, nothing enticing or extra involving. Bland sense of humour.

kind of an odd person, but she seems nice.  it doesn't matter how she marks unless she's your TA. Pretty lightweight compared to other english classes.  You don't have to talk in class, cause there are those 5 - 10 people who want to answer every single question.  i didn't like the class, but i think i would have hated any other english class.

course content is boring and so are her lectures. All over the place and unorganized. Takes attendance in lectures, so show up. She belongs in teaching elementary schools. Has no sense of time preparation, always lets u off late for ur next class. If u pay attention you'll do fine, Tas were helpful. I got a B+ in this course. Class not recommended

lectures are horrible and put you to sleep. She goes over irrelevant stuff to the course content, She picks on students for answers, always extends the class and doesnt let ppl go if they dont answer her questions, attendance in lectures counts, shes unorganized and all over the place, AWFUL CLASS!

HARD HARD CLASS! the stuff she goes thru in lecture is totally not relevant 2 da course.. not reali testable n goes quite off-topic fairly often! u dun hv 2 listen in lecture, evy1 just goes for the attendance mark. useless overhead material..never reali mentions abt the dramas we need 2 read BAD!

the course was easy.  nicky is really picky about marking essays - remember to use commas properly!  her lectures are really boring - tends to go off topic.  tutorials are pretty cheesy.  she might be a better high school teacher cuz of her personality.

He was engaging in class especially at 830 in the morning, his essay topics were pretty tough though, lectures are definitely helpful as long as you keep up in the reading the class is pretty manageable i'd definitely take him again.
Good Prof, entertaining while teaching but the final was painful. Fair marker.

This prof was alright, but he was a bit scattered throughout his lectures. I had no idea what i was writin down most of the time, so that sucked. Also, as far as TA's go, Steve Zillwood is awesome, and some little gnomes have told me their fellow friend Mark Pedrosa is a horrible TA and is quite unfair when it comes to marking...SO BEWARE
He's a really nice person but his exam was SO HARD!!!! Unbelievably hard for a first year class!!! Also, avoid having Mark Pedrosa as your TA, he's utterly useless.

If you are planning to take this class, make sure you read all the critics until you can memorize them. His lectures are not too bad but it was a bit out all over the place. His final exam was HARD!! But he has a nice personality. If you are taking this class though, DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT have Mark Pedrosa as your TA.

Dr. Ogden is a great professor, his lectures are pretty interesting and he's a really nice person who is open to discussion and differing opinions. That being said some of his assignments (such as a video project) aren't great...and avoid Mark Pedrosa as your TA at all costs, he's one of the worst I've ever had and graded assignments unfairly!

Extremely engaging lecturer. 2 essays, 1000 and 1500 words. My TA was a tough marker though. Our tutorial class also had to do a 10 line performance memorized or 50 line reading of the play. Plays he chose were interesting, and if you didn't understand, it was cleared up during lecture. Easy final, open book, a lot of writing though.
Lectures were fun and engaging, he made the material interesting, and I thoroughly enjoyed the class. One of the best profs I've had so far at SFU.
It's not just about the subject matter. This lady actually like to teach and she's good at it. Also, her hair is awesome...but a bit distracting.
Intro to Drama with Diana is fabulous! So fun, interesting and original. A great introduction to university English
If you have to take a first year English class, this one was really great.
Liked her a lot!

agree w/ comments both positive & negative... definitely easy, and very generous if you play the gender game. only thing really bugged me... during the primaries made comments about how Obama wasn't qualified. Ok, she's for Hillary, but not qualified? what is up with that?

Diana is obviously passionate about drama. She picked a lot of great plays for us to study in Fall 2008. There were only 2 papers, so the writing part wasn't too bad. She's very approachable and she makes lectures quite interesting. The bad thing is that Diana puts a lot of emphasis on totally trivial details, which can get really annoying.

good prof, nice and approachable. this is her first time teaching engl103 and i personally think she has done a good job at it. she has lecture audio recording available in case u miss her class. the exams are fair, probably can boost ur mark if u suck at essays. assignment, essays or reports, are marked by TAs. so pick a good TA ppl!
